title: Why Apple Sales Are Slipping
fulltext:
To the Editor:
Re“China’s Slump Leads to Drop in Apple Sales” (front page, Jan. 3):
A $50 Huawei smartphone does — pretty much — what an $800 iPhone does. So, yes, we can come up with all sort of theories why Apple is not raking it in as it used to. We can blame China. We can blame the millennials, not being as gullible as before and having less disposable income since their student loans are in the tens of thousands.
We can blame President Trump, of course. We can blame Qualcomm, for its patent battle. We can blame the fluctuating stock market, as if that were a new thing. We can blame Tim Cook, Apple’s chief executive, for not being innovative enough.
Or we can try to accept that things change and that what was “cool” and made sense yesterday might not be so today. This constant demand for the future to be predictable and advantageous is absurd, or maybe just a thing of the past.
Michele CastagnettiLos Angeles
